page.title: 02Pennyland Farm
page.content: Pennyland Farm is owned by Mr. William Alexander. It covers 283 acres. He has lived there for forty years. The farm buildings are over one hundred years old. There are thirteen fields, nine for animals and four for crops. He grows forty tons of barley, cuts grass for hay and seventeen tons for silage. Most of the barley is sold, the rest is stored in a barley pit while all the silage is kept. The hay bales are stacked in a barn, whose roof is soon to be renewed.He has three tractors to pull the machinery. They are a plough, a disc harrow, a roller, sower, mower, baler and a combine harvester. All his foodstuff is used to feed livestock. This year he has one bull, 64 cows, 62 calves and 40 stirks. He rears his cattle for beef. He sells his cattle throughout the year to a slaughterhouse or to cattle dealers.
